Description:
Detects potential process injection via Microsoft Remote Asssistance (Msra.exe) by looking at suspicious child processes spawned from the aforementioned process. It has been a target used by many threat actors and used for discovery and persistence tactics

Author: Alexander McDonald
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Potential Process Injection Via Msra.EXE
Query:
sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where parent_process_path like '%\msra.exe' and parent_command_line like '%msra.exe' and (process_path like '%\arp.exe' or process_path like '%\cmd.exe' or process_path like '%
et.exe' or process_path like '%
etstat.exe' or process_path like '%
slookup.exe' or process_path like '%oute.exe' or process_path like '%\schtasks.exe' or process_path like '%\whoami.exe')
